subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: SchemaCrawler has the capability to execute any arbitrary SQL, per table. The following variables are available to aid in the construction of queries - ${tabletype}, ${table}, and ${columns}. This example demonstrates how to execute arbitrary SQL, per table.

ol.li: Make sure that the Java executable is on your path.
Copy the SchemaCrawler jar file and schemacrawler.config.properties into the user-defined-query example directory.
Copy the hsqldb jar file from distribution directory into the user-defined-query example directory.
Start the database server by running StartDatabaseServer script from the distribution directory.
Start a command shell in the user-defined-query example directory.
Try modifying the schemacrawler.config.properties with different queries.
Redirect the output of SchemaCrawler into a file, by running user-defined-query.cmd > file.txt.
